org.semanticweb.rulewerk.core.model.api

Interface Predicate

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Entity
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    PredicateImpl

    public interface Predicate
extends Entity
    A Predicate represents a relation between terms. Is uniquely identified by its name and arity. The arity determines the number of terms allowed in the relation. For example, a Predicate with name P and arity n allows atomic formulae of the form P(t1,...,tn).
    Author:
    Irina Dragoste

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      int getArity()
      The arity represents the number of terms allowed as relation arguments for this Predicate.
      String getName()
      The name of the Predicate.

      • getArity

        int getArity()
        The arity represents the number of terms allowed as relation arguments for this Predicate. For example, a Predicate with name P and arity n allows atomic formulae of the form P(t1,...,tn).
        Returns:
        the arity of the Predicate.
